name: Four Points by Sheraton Niagara Falls Fallsview

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bought this online at a Great price (Monday to Thursday Special). The hotel is well- organized, efficient and close to where you want to be at the falls. It has an indoor pool and quite adequate fitness centre. There are several privately run restaurants on- site, at expected prices for the falls. We did have coupons for these but went elsewhere as prices are still high but that is just the area where the hotel is located. Parking is $12.00 across the street and $20.00 in the close hotel parking lot, again typical for Niagara Falls. Close to the casinos and at the price I do recommend this hotel and would go back.
reviews.title: Great Value at the Falls

reviews.text: We were treated with respect, the breakfast was awesome! The staff were there to help with anything, and the way they treated each customer equally is something every hotel should achieve for.
reviews.title: Our Canada Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And a huge thank you to Jack (sorry Jack, but we couldn't remember your surname!). Thank you for your hospitality, we hope you are feeling better if you are reading this. After hearing that you have not been well.
reviews.title: Great stay as always

reviews.text: Your golden girls (The 4 English ladies) ;)
reviews.title: A Great Location, overlooks the Falls. Nice well keep Hotel, Resort. Nice clean rooms. Value for your money.

reviews.text: We almost always stay here when we go to Niagara about 3 times a year. The housekeeping staff are great as well as the front desk staff. The rooms are well equipped. The pillows are the best I always sleep well here. The carpets are a little dirty as I have noticed before but for the price and the location you can`t beat it. Parking at the Casino across the street is only $5 but we always use are PAC card and it`s free. If you gamble get a PAC card at the Casino and parking is free depending on how much points you accumulate at the Casino. Adios Amigos, Albondigas!
reviews.title: Confusing Layout and Disappointing "fallsview"

reviews.text: The room was fine - regular size hotel room with a cute little foyer with granite-topped table, foyer gave a little extra space for luggage storage. No fridge in room. The breakfast at the IHOP in the lobby was $90 for 2 adult meals and 3 kids menu meals - we found this outrageous! Better off going to Tim Horton's in the food court at Fallsview Casino mall next door, accessible thru skyway. Pool was nice and temperature was warm, but it was heavily chlorinated, so bring goggles. There are 2 smallish hot tubs in pool area, but only 1 was working. Food was very expensive even at downscale chains like Denny's ($80 for dinner). More moderate places like Macaroni Grill next door also more than U.S. ($135 for dinner). We expected this to be a cheap spring break, but the food cost was over $300 per day, so be warned! Attractions are also expensive, but this was expected.
reviews.title: Good location, food is expensive

reviews.text: Stayed here on a Travelzoo deal and it surpassed my expectations!
reviews.title: Four Points - Fallsview

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has undergone renovations in the past few years and although I can't remember which hotel it used to be . . . .the improvements are all good!!
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main entrance is no longer off Fallsview Blvd but around the back and the lobby entrance is nice.
reviews.title: Four Points Sheraton - Fallsview

reviews.text: Check in was very busy upon arrival and hotel staff were fast, efficient, & friendly. Our room was very clean, decor was typical and pillows were heavenly!
reviews.title: Bad Hotel Practice

reviews.text: We stayed here the last weekend in May for one night for my birthday. We phoned a week prior and were told at that time that the hotel was almost full, and for this reason, they would not allow for any discounts, government discounts included. My boyfriend told the lady who did the booking that it was a special occasion. This was never mentioned during our stay, not even a simple Happy Birthday by the staff. My The day we arrived I checked pricing on the website and found that the same room was $50 cheaper. I was not impressed.
reviews.title: Overpriced but nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were put in a room close to the pool and found the smell of chlorine to be quite strong in the hallway.
reviews.title: Good location and very nice accomodations

reviews.text: Aside from this, we did enjoy our stay. Our room was clean and spacious and the beds were nice and comfortable. Our view was terrible, we faced the side of a building.
reviews.title: A great room, excellent value and nice service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the future we will probably not stay here again, I don't like being ripped off.
reviews.title: Nice, Clean Hotel

reviews.text: Close to the falls and an indoor walkway to the casino. The rooms are spacious, although the bathrooms are relatively small. Service is very good. We were able to check-in around noon and given an upgraded room without asking. Good restaurant choices in and near the facility. Prices were lower than comparable hotels. Would definitely stay here on the next trip.
reviews.title: Reasonable Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel using Groupon, and was very pleasantly surprised. Great location! Hotel has shuttle to Table Rock-Niagara falls tourist starting spot. Room was large and beautiful. Ck-in is at 3p but we called in the morning,and were able to check in at 1030am...self park $12 unlimited in and out, across the street! Super! Pool and hot tub were clean and open till 11pm.Great location. Would definitely recommend this hotel and location. Hotel provides FREE water bottles in the room
reviews.title: great hotel, super location, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights just after Labor Day. We bought a Travel Zoo voucher that included some other items. After reading other reviews, I expected to be hassled to upgrade rooms. That wasn't the case. We checked in and were given a room in the newly renovated section. The room was large and the bed was comfortable. The hotel was bigger than expected and very conveniently located. I appreciated the free water, and free wifi- though I will say the wifi was extremely slow.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The voucher was essentially good for 2 for 1 dinners at the restaurants. I thought that was great given that all the chain restaurants jacked their prices by a minimum of $10. The fitness center was nice with updated equipment and free weights. There were always people enjoying the pool.
reviews.title: CONVENIENT FALLS LOCATION, FRIENDLY
Close anf convient
reviews.text: All in all, I'd return to this hotel and would recommend it to friends.

We arrived before 11 am to find out when ou room would be ready. It was already available. Super as now we could start our sightseeing at our leisure. Shuttle busses stop just behind hotel. Parking only $12 about half other hotels. Our Falls View room was just as advertised and reasonably spacious. Flat screen HDTV. Had several dealing with the staff all of whom were very freindly.
reviews.title: My stay one night during labour day weekend

reviews.text: We had one of the Groupon vouchers (2-night stay; vouchers for IHOP, Dave & Busters, Outback, and the Keg Steakhouse) so we were not quite sure what to exepct. Arrived on a Thursday afternoon were warmly greeted by the staff and the clerk noted that I was a Starwood Preferred Guest (although no points awarded) which I thought was a nice touch. However, he did provide us with complimentary vouchers that we could use at another time by virtue of that membership!
reviews.title: Not Bad for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was not hard to get to, and in a pretty good location. There were plenty of places nearby to eat--the only drawback is having to pay a ridiculous amount for parking. They want you to pay between $10 and $15 per night for unsecured parking. Total rip-off. We parked in the sheltered casino lot (free if you are a Casino Niagara card menu and you have actively gambled on each given day).
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay, Casino Convenient

reviews.text: The hotel had a Starbucks and IHOP downstairs. We had vouchers for the IHOP and the food and the service were great. Food at all the places is definitely overpriced though. Vouchers barely covered meals.
reviews.title: Fantastic View!
Noisy and badly managed
reviews.text: We were quickly checked in to a nice corner room on an upper floor. Room was quite spacious for two people, and we had more than enough room to spread out. We were there to gamble so after scoping out the hotel we headed over to the casino. Didn't have to go outside to access--could use the walkway that connected the casino to the 4-Points and I believe it was the Hilton right next door.

We used our vouchers to the Keg Steakhouse and Outback. Both meals were excellent, but both were very much overpriced. Need to make a reservation for the Steakhouse. We had 7 p.m. which seemed to be the right time, because it was packed by 8.
reviews.title: Great Stay at the Four Points Sheraton!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: King Room with Whirpool Tub. Room was clean and neat. Very pleased... enjoyed the tub with jets. The pillows and mattress were wonderful and the complimentary bottle of water was a nice touch. The $30 voucher for the Ruth Chris Steakhouse is fine if you intend to spend well over $50 per plate for dinner. We heard the IHOP was pricey but enjoyed the Country Chalet Breakfast across the street. 1 of 2 elevators to our section of rooms (they had 6 elevators overall) was out of order but I understand there was an elevator worker union strike which was slowing repairs. This likely was part of the reason I did hear extra traffic and the stairway door closing, which did happen to be right outside our room. My wife didn't hear a thing but it woke me a few times through the night but I can't hold that against the hotel... just something I would recommend to others to be gentler when closing doors during the night.
reviews.title: Little Getaway

reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at the Four Points at the end of May 2013. The hotel room was spacious and clean. The bathroom was clean but very small. My two sons and I stayed in a room with two queen beds and were quite comfortable. It was just a short walk to the falls and a short walk to many restaurants. It rained two of the nights were were there so we did one of the many restaurants connected by the walkway. The Four Points has 3 restaurants but the hotel is also connected to the Hilton and the Casino by a walkway so there are lots of eating options that don't require you stepping out if the weather is bad. My only complaint was the parking.... You have the choice of parking on property for $20/day or parking across the street and down the block a bit for $12/day. We chose the parking lot across the street and I was suprised to find that it is completely dark and feels very remote. There were no lights in the lot and I have to admit I was a little nervous on the days we parked after dark. Other than that, the staff was friendly, the room was clean, the location was good and the price was right.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel....Would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is really nice, our room was very good, well renovated, nice design.
reviews.title: Very nice place

reviews.text: The hotel situated 10 minutes drive from Niagara Falls, right on a Niagara river.
reviews.title: Great Stay, but charged for a local call

reviews.text: We liked restaurant on a first floor for dinner.
reviews.title: Above Average Hotel with a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a one night stay and we always enjoy ourselves in Niagara. One thing we know they can do to improve is the room cleanliness, not that we are picky but this always seems to be an issue, just vacuuming better and cleaning hairs off the bathroom floor type of thing nothing serious. Other than that nothing to complain about the front desk staff as always was friendly and helpful, smooth check in and check out and a great location. Breakfast for room service and at the IHOP is ridiculously expensive we opted for Tim Hortons in the Galleria in the Casino, or across the street also The Famous at the Galleria sounded good and prices were ok considering it is in the Casino. Adios Amigos!
reviews.title: Always a great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We bought a deal on Living Social for a one night stay with a $40 voucher for The Keg Steakhouse, $40 voucher for Outback Steakhouse, $20 for the in hotel iHop for $119. We booked a jacuzzi room and upgraded to a falls view room for an extra $30 which we both thought was worth it. The room was very clean, the jacuzzi was wonderful and you couldn't beat the location (within walking distance to the Horse Shoe Falls). The staff was wonderful and very pleasant and the overall hotel was very clean and nice. We were sad that you couldn't see the American Falls from the hotel since the massive casino blocks the view to that but the view of the Horse Shoe falls was great! Especially when they light it up in the evening!!! It was very relaxing to sit in the room and view the falls when ever we wanted. The location was great! We walked to almost everything without a problem. However if you to go further up towards the American Falls I would suggest the shuttle that picks you up right outside the hotel. The only issue we had was the linens on the bed. House keeping tried to cover the mattress with a flat sheet instead of a fitted sheet so all night, when ever we moved around the bottom sheet would pull up leaving us laying on the exposed mattress...YUCK!!!!! The bed was very comfortable otherwise. Parking was $12 a night and was located across the street which was fine for us. Overall, a great location and value!!!!
reviews.title: Great value with a wonderful location!

reviews.text: We just got back from a trip to Niagara Falls Canada!! The Four Points Sheraton Niagara Falls Fallsview is a wonderful Hotel!! Staff was very friendly and helpful!! Ask for a Falls view room on a high floor and you won't be disappointed!! We stayed in room 1812 (top floor) 2 queen beds and were so impressed by the beautiful view of The Horseshoe Falls!!! The room was also very clean and the beds were VERY comfortable!!! Thank you Sheraton for making our trip to Niagara Falls a wonderful experience!!!!! I am missing the falls today!!!!
reviews.title: This hotel was fabulous!!!

reviews.text: Shelly Huneck
reviews.title: Disappointed in the view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has a few positive things--fairly clean rooms, friendly staff, free wi-fi, and free shuttle service--and a few negative things--rooms are not well insulated so sounds from other rooms and the hallways are loud in the room, parking is higher than it should be for the location, full-sized sheets on queen sized beds made for a jumbled mess, and the on-site breakfast restaurant (IHOP) has crazy prices ($20 for pancakes!!).
reviews.title: Nice spot to stay

reviews.text: We very nearly cancelled the two rooms we had booked and payed for at this hotel due to some poor reviews, but were glad we didnt when we arrived. We were travelling from nyc on a road trip accross north america and decided it was pointless even bothering to go to this hotel because there were some terrible reviews in the last few weeks. We ended up at this hotel because we arrived in niagara falls at 1am and was too late with 4 kids to look for another hotel. We entered rather worriedly into our rooms and were greeted with a musty smell which worried me a little but that soon dispersed and the very large and clean rooms made up for everything. I really am perplexed at peoples reviews. I dont know if we had a recently furbished room but i can say that it was just like any other sheraton i have stayed at. Also, there are some very nice restaurants in walking distance from this hotel. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Good hotel. Dont know what all the fuss is about!!!

reviews.text: Several rooms booked here for a family vacation at the Falls for 4 nights. We all liked this hotel.
reviews.title: Convenience and more!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect location, close to major attractions.
reviews.title: This is a great hotel - Great rates and great rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were clean, staff was friendly.
reviews.title: Not worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All 9 of us would stay here again.
reviews.title: Awesome view !

reviews.text: The hotel is pleasant but slightly away from the main falls view. If you have small kids with you, you might want to avoid staying in this hotel. While with kids, try to select a hotel at the fallsview blvd, you may find lot of activities for kids.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My son bought me this one night get away for my birthday which we used in February 2013. I was not impressed with having to pay to park but understand that it is the norm. We upgraded our room to include a Jacuzzi tub. The tub was nice but there were almost no jets, (4). We had a Falls view which might have been nice had it not been raining, (no fault of the hotel of course). The bed was comfortable and there was a couch in the room which allowed for somewhere else to sit which I appreciated. We ate in the IHOP, on site. My issue with the hotel is that we were charged on our check in, (you know how they ask for your credit card imprint) for the parking, the upgrades, etc. and then upon checking out, we were charged again. We were there in Feb and it is now May and I'm still disputing this matter with the hotel. They insist that the second charge was removed automatically, however, I still have a double charge on my credit card. To be cont...
reviews.title: Niagara Falls get away

reviews.text: Good Getaway Located rite where U want 2 be. Everything close 4 convenience The staff couldn't be more helpful if they wanted 2 be. Always looking after all guests. The rate for the room was decent. The staff asked if we wanted an upgraded room, something they did not have to do. Made sure all ameneties were what we needed for the stay.
reviews.title: Good Getaway

reviews.text: Booked 2 rooms here for one night (Memorial Day weekend). One room was facing the back parking lot, the other room facing front of hotel with partial falls view. The room facing the falls was smaller in size vs. the room facing parking lot. But both rooms were so clean, modern, and beautiful décor. Nice lighting. The King bed, linens, pillows were top notch nice and comfortable. Beautiful bathroom, plenty of counter space, hair dryer, in the shower was dispensers for shampoo, conditioner, and shower gel. We paid $12 to park our vehicle across the street in a large lot. That was cheap compared to paying $20 at a neighboring hotel where they valet your car for the day/overnight and you have NO ACCESS to your vehicle. Won't be doing that again!! All employees were encountered were very friendly and helpful. There is a Starbucks and an IHop restaurant in the lobby, and an access bridge walkway to the Casino. There are plenty of restaurants surrounding this hotel and others all within walking distance. You can't beat the location of the Four Points by Sheraton. We walked down to the falls, a good 15 minute walk. I did not hear any noise at night except for someone letting the door slam shut at 2am, otherwise it was nice and quiet considering how busy the hotel was.
reviews.title: Very Nice Accomodations, Modern, Clean and Quiet.

reviews.text: When we were booking rooms at Niagara Falls we needed a clean and family-friendly place. We pretty much put our faith in the Sheraton brand and our overall experience at this property was not disappointing but not stellar either. Having booked our rooms through Expedia at a discounted rate we were not expecting any red carpet treatment. The only annoyance was in the form of a parking fee (even if one opts to self-park) and this I was not expecting from Sheraton. The rooms were clean and quite spacious. There was no complimentary breakfast offered, which was a bit surprising. They do have an IHOP and a couple other restaurants in the hotel premises. FYI, if you're from the US then you probably want to be ready for a few sticker shocks in restaurants in Niagara Falls. I later discovered that this is a general Canadian characteristic but that is a different story.
reviews.title: Nothing spectacular

reviews.text: Brilliant view. It was a beautiful room. The service was good. The restaurants in the hotel weren't good.
reviews.title: Fun

reviews.text: BEWARE OF YOUIR VALUABLES - WALLET, MONEY, KEYS!
reviews.title: STAY AWAY!!! AWFUL AND UNFRIENDLY STAFF! WORST EXPERIENCE

reviews.text: Wallet went missing from a night-table drawer of the room. Hotel staff had friends within the room and was very defensive when presented with the situation. Did absolutely nothing to investigate the matter but instead offered denials! Never did find the wallet which was in the drawer of a night-table! Beware! Choose other options! Management have very poor customer service skills - not very responsive nor cared to deal with the matter. we were given the run-around when asked for telephone numbers of the gm, owners, etc. Fiiisshhhhyyyy - definitely an inside job! Hilton, Marriott, Fallsview , Double Tree Hotels, all excellent options! If you want to safeguard your belongings and want to deal with an honest and caring staff and hospitality expected from a major hotel you won't find it here! STAY AWAY!
reviews.title: Great accommodations- pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: After reading some reviews we were a little apprehensive with what to expect. We got two separate Group on deals for $95 under two separate names. There was no problems combining the vouchers other than having to go to the desk the next day to show them that days voucher but there was no changing rooms or actual checking out and having to wait to check back in.
reviews.title: Better than my last visit!

reviews.text: For each group on we got 2-$20 Dave and busters game play cards and free mini golf. Gift cards for two different restaurants which they both said "we use these just like cash"(one was $40 and the other $25). Also free shuttle around the local attractions.
reviews.title: Four Points Sheraton Niagara Falls NOT Parent Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking for a night away from the kids. Took advantage of a Groupon deal and got one nights stay including coupons for The Keg, IHOP, Dave & Busters and a couple other places. Used the Keg coupon for the restaurant overlooking the falls and the IHOP one for breakfast the next day. Needed the coupon cuz IHOP sure knows how to screw people for a breakfast.
reviews.title: Quick couples getaway

reviews.text: The hotel was very busy with it being the Thursday leading into the Labour Day weekend. I was checked in swiftly and with no issues. Couldn't see the point in paying for valet service so I did the self park option.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: Our room was small but clean and typical of an entry level room. Could have used a refrigerator (something nearly every hotel I have been to now has) so we ended up filling the sink with ice.
reviews.title: Great Location to Falls and attractipns

reviews.text: Used the pool (which was a tad too warm to be refreshing) and the hot tub (which was hot enough to keep the kids out). Both were clean and well maintained.
reviews.title: Confortable Room, Nice Area, Somewhat of a view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would we go back to this hotel? Probably not as we prefer the business of the Clifton Hill area and are not really casino people.
reviews.title: Nothing but great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Four Points is SPG's not quite motel, not quite full-service hotel offering. If you're an SPG person, and the Sheraton at the Falls is booked, this is your only other option on the Canadian side. This was my first time at this hotel, but I've stayed at the Sheraton (on both sides of the border) many times.
reviews.title: Location Good. Rooms OK. Staff Relatively Friendly.

reviews.text: The location is great - it's connected to the Fallsview casino, within walking distance to the horseshoe falls and a ton of restaurants, and about a 10 minute/$10 cab ride to Clifton Hill.
reviews.title: Nice Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Rooms are OK. This used to be a Radisson, and then something else before, so it's not quite up to spec with modern Four Points. This problem isn't really specific to this property either - hotels in Niagara Falls change ownership like most people change their underwear, so all offerings in NF are generally sub-par to most of their brands' brothers and sisters in major cities.
reviews.title: Nice rooms, good location

reviews.text: The hotel and the restaurants onsite (East Side Marios, IHOP) are expensive for what you get. It's the Niagara Falls tax, and you just have to be prepared for it. I would never pay $250/night for a Four Points anywhere else on the planet, but here, that's what you have to pay.
reviews.title: Not Bad

reviews.text: The Staff was relatively friendly. The maids are very good. The checkin counter leaves a bit to be desired (no mention of SPG benefits you're entitled to), but had no problem requesting and receiving the coveted 4 PM late checkout that SPG Gold/Plats get.
reviews.title: Yes and No. Good and Bad.

aka: Four Points By Sheraton Niagara Falls Fallsview Hotel
description: Four Points by Sheraton Niagara Falls Fallsview is connected to Fallsview Casino/Dragonfly Nightclub by indoor walkway. Our hotel is near Maid of theMist boat ride and Scotia Bank Convention Centre
